intro: Phlomis montana, commonly known as mountain phlomis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, producing showy pink to purple blooms in late summer. Phlomis montana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
